result.execSummary:
The defendant Adalberto Hernandez Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: AS TO COUNTS ONE, TWO AND THREE, EACH COUNT:  Concurrent with all other  counts and to sentence the defendant is currently serving. Credit for 167 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adalberto Hernandez Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (18 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing 07-31-2015 received and filed.

Defendant Adalberto Hernandez in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Adalberto Hernandez in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 1, 2, and 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  9 YEARS with 167 days credit CONCURRENT to all other counts and to sentence the defendant is currently serving; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS and 6 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program but only after serving 3.5 years.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No contact with the co-actors of victims specified in the Criminal Complaint.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $50.00 payable to Danny B., joint and several with co-actors; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and any victim surcharges); 
All applicable fees of supervision, this can be based on a budget plan.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
in support of the defendant received and filed.

Defendant Adalberto Hernandez in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Adalberto Hernandez in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to negotiations, Count 4 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing, as to Counts 1-3:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant received and filed.

Attorney Adam c Essling in court, defendant Adalberto Hernandez not in court, in custody.  Thomas Potter for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adalberto Hernandez in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Adalberto Hernandez in custody.  Ron Dague for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring INCLUDING drug testing.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with WITNESS:  EMILY G.; ALLEGED VICTIMS:  JONATHAN B., HARRY N., MARQUIS  M., DANIEL B., AND CO-DEF'S:  KIMBERLY MEYER, NICHOLAS WELLS, LORI WILBUR AND ANTHONY ZYDZIK.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Adalberto Hernandez in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Adalberto Hernandez in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
